  physical_appearance: A pair of Second World War puttees used by the British army is displayed. It is khaki in colour. There are two straps at the top of each gaiter
 and two small buckles at the bottom. These fastening items are all brown in colour. There are no tears on both leggings.

  subject_terms_1: worn costume accessories world wars soldier gaiters military uniforms

 1939 - 1945 Leggings

  context_6: Southeast Asia

  context_7: Great Britain. Army

  sgcool_label_text: This pair of puttees were part of the British Army uniform during WWII. Soldiers wore them on the lower part of their legs
 typically wound around from the ankle to the knee for protection and support.
